schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY)
schemes.description: Provides health insurance coverage to low-income families.
schemes.benefits: Health coverage up to ₹5 lakh per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization.
schemes.applicationProcess: Beneficiaries are identified based on the Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC) 2011 data. Eligible families can get an e-card from a designated hospital or Common Service Center (CSC). No formal application is needed if you are on the list.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Urban (PMAY-U)
schemes.description: Aims to provide affordable housing to the urban poor.
schemes.benefits: Credit-linked subsidy on home loans for different income groups (EWS, LIG, MIG-I, MIG-II).
schemes.applicationProcess: Apply online through the official PMAY-U website or through Common Service Centers (CSCs). Fill in personal and income details, and upload required documents. The application is then verified by urban local bodies.

schemes.name: Digital India Internship Scheme
schemes.description: Offers internship opportunities to students in the field of technology and e-governance.
schemes.benefits: A stipend of ₹10,000 per month and a certificate upon successful completion.
schemes.applicationProcess: Applications are invited online through the National Informatics Centre (NIC) website, usually twice a year. Students need to fill out an online form and upload their resume and a letter from their institution. Shortlisted candidates are called for an interview.
